archimate:ApplicationComponent.documentation:
Electronic Health Record (EHR) System
A digital version of a patient’s medical history maintained over time by one or more providers. Core Functionalities:
• Clinical documentation (progress notes, diagnoses, medications) • Prescriptions & e-Prescribing • Lab and imaging results integration • Alerts and decision support • Chronic disease tracking
Workflows: • Encounter documentation → Orders (labs, meds) → Results review → Care planning → Follow-up
Data Types: • Patient history, medications, allergies, immunizations, lab results, vital signs
Integration Points: • HIS: For patient movement and billing • LIMS, RIS, PACS: For lab and imaging results • CDR: Clinical data repositories • Patient Portals: For engagement and access
Example Software: • RioMed Cellma • Epic Systems • Cerner PowerChart • Allscripts Sunrise
Relationships:
o Integrates with → PACS: For embedding medical images in patient records o Integrates with → RIS: For radiology reports and workflow o Runs on → VM Host Cluster: Virtualized for high availability o Backed up by → Backup System: For data protection and compliance o Accessed by → Clinical Workstations: Primary user interface for clinicians o Receives data from → Bedside Monitors: Automated integration of patient vitals o Secured by → Identity Management: For proper access control o Protected by → Data Encryption: For PHI security compliance
